Address: Cnr Lyons and Grant Street Newbridge VIC 3551
Description:
Beautiful Landscape
Within easy walking distance of the town centre and the mighty Loddon River, this bushy block consists of 6 allotments in 5 titles. The property is part Township Zone and part Farming Zone and fronts 2 roads. An old V-Line carriage will be included in the sale.

Description:
IDEAL PROPERTY JUST A STONE'S THROW FROM THE LODDON RIVER FLATS!
* Three bedrooms all with built in robes.
* Timber throughout.
* Polished floorboards.
* Cathedral ceilings.
* Kitchen with plenty of workbench space.
* Dishwasher.
* Open lounge.
* Wood heater.
* Split system.
* Bathroom with shower & bath.
* Separate toilet.
* Studio/teenage retreat.
* Satellite NBN.
* Approx. 50' x 20' GI shed with concrete floor with roller doors.
* Open front machinery/car & equipment shed.
* BioCycle sewerage system.
* Bore.
Newbridge is a popular fishing and camping location and Twiggs Lane is only a three minute walk to the water's edge, or five minutes to the General Store, Hotel, Community Hall and Sports ground.
This block approx. 1.5 acres, is amongst a great neighbourhood all at a distance, a good gravel road and only a 30 minute drive to Bendigo.
The home features timber throughout, polished floorboards, cathedral ceilings and its kitchens "Tasmanian Oak" cupboards, plenty of workbench space and dishwasher. The kitchen window overlooks the river flats amidst the local birdlife and wildlife.
Open lounge offers a freestanding wood heater, large split system and front portico plus a larger elevated timber patio/veranda area at the front of the home to enjoy the view.
All three bedrooms have BIR's or wall storage with the third bedroom possibly an office/study or it would be ideal as a younger child's room.
Bathroom has shower, bath, IXL heat lamp & vanity and the separate toilet. At the rear of the home bricked paved patio, plenty of water with numerous poly and galvanised rain water tanks totally 75,000 litre plus the connection to the local bore water.
The shedding is a dream! Approx. 50 x 20 GI shed with concrete floor & two roller doors is at the back of the house. Behind and off the same roof is a similar open front machinery/car & equipment shed with one end enclosed as another workshop/storage area. Eight solar panels and a 2.2 KVA system, BioCycle sewerage system, additional sheds, fernerys and drought proof shrubs and trees.
You won't be disappointed.
INSPECTIONS BY APPOINTMENT ONLY.

Description:
AMAZING LIFESTYLE
This is a rare opportunity to purchase an extremely well-built home which backs onto the Bendigo Regional Park. The home sits in a quiet cul de sac with an elevated outlook towards Autumn Gully. There is a paved area at the rear of the home with amazing bush views. The home was a builder's own home and they certainly don't build them like this anymore. Offering a sunken lounge with solid fuel heater and cathedral ceilings, spacious kitchen / meals / family room, 3 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms. If you like your toys or hobbies there is plenty of room for you with a large double garage under the house, a big workshop/ shed / hobby room plus additional storage which might make a great wine cellar. There is also a large 2 car carport ideal for a boat or most caravans. An additional single garage completes the car accommodation. Wonderfully landscaped gardens compliment the secluded setting. Great access to the city centre and Spring Gully primary school.
This wonderful home is really quite special.
Note: ALL ENQUIRY MUST INCLUDE A PHONE NUMBER
PHOTO ID REQUIRED AT INSPECTIONS

Description:
SECURE, PRIVATE & AN EASY WALK TO CBD
An easy walk to both the centre of the city and the hospital precinct, this property is ideally positioned just a few doors down from the popular Boundary Hotel and Catherine McAuley College (St Marys Campus). Sitting behind a high, secure fence with an automated double gate offering vehicle access and good off-street parking, this low-maintenance home serves a variety of potential buyers.
A deck at the front door leads inside, opening directly into a large and light lounge. Off the lounge is a kitchen diner with timber cabinetry, timber flooring and modern appliances. A door from the lounge leads through to a hallway at the rear.
Off the hallway are three good-sized bedrooms and each of the rooms benefit from ample natural light and built-in robes. A linen closet and a family bathroom with corner spa also can be found off the hallway, and at the rear of the home is a large laundry with separate toilet and access to the backyard.
A deck off the back of the home, with stainless steel balustrade, is perfect for alfresco living and provides a lovely outlook across North Bendigo. Steps lead down to a lawn area, raised garden beds and various outbuildings include a large garden shed, wood shed and storage room that is fully insulated and plumbed with shower and toilet. This space could also be utilised as a workshop or extra living area.
Additional features include:
Ducted evaporative cooling and ducted gas heating
Modern kitchen appliances including four-burner gas cooktop, oven and dishwasher
Good storage
Double carport (tandem) and additional off-street parking behind front fence with electric gate
Access from both sides of the house to the rear
External security system at front and rear of home
Sitting so close to all amenities and offering plenty of privacy, this easy-care home is ideal for an investor seeking a solid rental in the heart of the city. Alternatively, this is a fantastic opportunity for a buyer looking to step on to the property ladder with a home that provides great scope and value-adding potential.
Insights: 5 Hustlers Road, Bendigo VIC 3550 was last sold in 2020 and 81 other 3 bedroom house in Bendigo have recently been sold.

Description:
BUILD FOR LIFESTYLE & CONVENIENCE
This land opportunity is on the doorstep of the CBD, yet is quietly tucked away. Fronting onto Langston Street this rectangular 420m2 allotment is steps away from parkland, a stroll to the Bendigo Corner Store Cafe and is surrounded by the best of Bendigos historical architecture.
You can build your comfortable dream home yet be surrounded by charming streets steeped in history. This block has original bluestone guttering to the front, is flanked by miners cottages, and will treat you to glimpses of church steeples on the skyline as you wander to the café for your morning coffee and newspapers.
Close to hospitals, walking distance to the CBD and schools, this is the perfect location for lifestyle and convenience.
420m2 rectangular allotment
A rare opportunity in an established and historical location
Walk to the CBD and cafes
Steps away from parkland, playground and hockey fields
Close to hospitals

Description:
An Ideal Get-Away Property
HANDYMAN'S DELIGHT!
What an opportunity! Originally on the market at $230,000, this partially cleared bush block of 46 acres approx of undulating land has now been reduced to $210,000!
Zoned Rural Living and sitting in a secluded court position, it has a gentle slope and some flat areas ideal for building. Enjoying some cleared areas, the block has assorted groups of trees dotted over the block, and a lovely dam. As a bonus there is power to the street as well as an electricity pole on the land itself.
As an additional bonus, there is also an old two bedroom shack with kitchen and open plan living. This structure is in need of restoration as it has been damaged by a fallen tree (since removed) but would once again make a comfortable weekender for someone with handyman ability.
Cornella is a lovely part of the country, wineries abound and Camelback Vinyard is at the end of the street. Situated only 10 minutes approx from the Toolleen General store and popular Hotel and 20 minutes approx from the delightful town of Heathcote, well known for its wonderful wineries. Bendigo is just 40 minutes away and Melbourne a short 2 hour approx drive. This would be a great place to unwind. Phone to inspect.
Property Code: 963

Description:
An Absolute Hole In One!
Nestled behind the low maintenance Established gardens of 22 Kingston Drive is this three bedroom beauty with so much more than meets the eye.
Stepping inside you will immediately appreciate the sense of elegance and feel right at home with 8 foot ceilings, Wide hallways and LED Downlights throughout.
The Kitchen, living and dining areas immediately grabs your attention complete with Induction Cooktop, 900mm Oven, LG Dishwasher, Caesarstone benchtops & an abundance of storage space in the kitchen. A Rennai Gas log fire sits within the wall of the lounge area providing a touch of class to an already sophisticated area.
All three bedrooms that occupy the property are of ample size. The master containing a walk in robe and ensuite bathroom complete with double vanity, extra-large shower and separate toilet. The remaining two bedrooms have built in robes. A central bathroom can also be found in this area of the home containing a bath, single vanity and shower with a second separate toilet.
The study of the home is more than meets the eye. Once the fourth bedroom for the property, this room can easily be converted back into a bedroom. But as it currently stands, two built in desks sit in the room with an abundance of desk space on each. Between the two desks is a murphy bed folded into the room, so without even needing to convert the room back this area already lends itself to provide that extra bed space for guests. Or this area can be used as a third living area.
In the backyard of the property the theme of a low maintained lifestyle continues. With all areas of the backyard being either turfed, tiled or concreted. You (or your tenants) will be able to enjoy the fantastic outdoor entertaining area without any concerns of the gardens getting away from you. There is a wood fire undercover to stay warm and connections are in place if you wish to add an outdoor kitchen to the area.
All this is located literally across the road from the Neangar Park Golf Club and in close proximity to Eaglehawk CBD, Eaglehawk Primary and secondary schools and a cruisy 10 minute drive (approx.) into the Bendigo CBD.

Description:
MCIVOR HILL RENOVATOR / INVESTOR OPPORTUNITY
Don't think twice - you will need to be quick regarding this one! Do yourself a favour and come and see if this original dwelling situated in the tightly held McIvor Hill precinct suits your needs.
It's an affordable entry-level opportunity to this prime area.
Renovate and rejuvenate and let your imagination run wild with multiple options to create long term equity. Whether it's a major overhaul, a stunning new home, a development or, alternatively invest and land bank while you reap the rewards of a tenant in place.
It's located minutes to all conveniences including local bakery and take away shops, All Seasons Resort, Coles supermarket, medical clinics, Strathdale Park and public transport.
The home features a welcoming front patio, roomy entry hall, three bedrooms, spacious lounge, original kitchen/meals, bathroom, separate laundry, carport and garage/workshop.
The property has a few rough edges but the prime location is great motivation for a rescue or redevelopment mission(STCA).

Description:
FAMILY-FRIENDLY WITH CONTEMPORARY COTTAGE FEEL
This beautifully presented, light-filled home sits in the heart of the family-friendly Acacia Park Estate, just minutes to bus stops, primary schools, supermarkets, shops and bakery. With the many amenities of Epsom, White Hills and Eaglehawk all within a short drive, the property is also walking distance to a play area and recreation reserve.
A pretty flat-top picket fence, lush lawn and contemporary cottage-styling with timber gable spires and large radius windows offer fantastic curb appeal. The home sits on a corner allotment, ensuring the garden wraps around most of the house. Indoors, a wide entry opens on one side to a spacious study, and a master bedroom offering a ceiling fan, walk-in robe and ensuite. The remaining two bedrooms are positioned leading from a hallway off the central living area. Both bedrooms enjoy ceiling fans and built-in robes, and there is a third room which can be used as a study or a small bedroom. This section of the house also includes a family bathroom, separate toilet, and a laundry with sliding door access to the side yard.
A large formal lounge towards the front of the home overlooks a lawn area at one side of the house, and at the end of the main hallway is the light and bright open plan kitchen, living and dining room. With dual aspect glass sliding doors, this room is flooded with natural light and the additional windows ensure there is space to watch the kids outside, wherever they choose to play.
At the rear of the house is a wide deck, perfect for outdoor entertaining, and this overlooks a neat lawn and garden beds with established planting. The other side of the home offers a sunny paved courtyard, lawn and a wide verandah that wraps around the house. In between the two outdoor spaces is the double garage, allowing easy access off the side street.
Additional features include:
Ducted gas heating
Split system heating and cooling
Ceiling fans in all bedrooms
Modern kitchen appliances including dishwasher, oven and four-burner gas cooktop
Double garage with auto roller door accessed off side street
Solar power (20 panel, 5.7kw)
Water tank (2,000l)
Tinting on front and side windows
Automated sprinkler system in garden
Neat as a pin, this property is perfect for a buyer seeking a move-in ready home in a lovely, family friendly neighbourhood. Just minutes to all amenities, this easy-care and modern build has much to offer at a fantastic price.

Description:
Country Living, City Style
Located in sought-after McIvor Forest Estate on a generous 902m2 block, this four bedroom residence is worth your consideration.
Its contemporary feel and natural light-filled spaces make this 10 year old home a very attractive proposition.
Completely refreshed and beautifully presented this quality built home has a truly tasteful bathroom and en-suite as well as a great layout.
It seamlessly connects its indoor and outdoor spaces.
There is expansive decking overlooking the inground pool which is salt-chlorinated and sits in an attractive and private landscaped garden which is complete with rainwater tank.
Inside the home, the high standard is maintained with a kitchen stone bench, two living areas, ducted heating and cooling and a security alarm system.
The interior has been freshly painted and there are new carpets and flooring.
Need access for your caravan, boat or trailer?
This property has a 4 metre side entrance onto this superb sized block.
Lovely forest surrounds and a village feel, so close to town.
You'll be smitten!

Description:
"Magnificent Farmlet"
3 bedroom brick veneer residence, 2 with BIRs, master with W.I.R & ensuite, open living plan with large timber kitchen featuring all electric cooking, dining lounge area with freestanding Coonarra wood heater, stained glass front entrance with formal living area. Ducted heating/cooling features throughout the house. 3 large bedrooms all with ceiling fans, study, separate toilet, large bathroom with spa bath & separate shower, toilet, laundry & large 2 car under roof garage with automatic roller door, house also has solarhart. Outside is extensive verandas, 2-car carport with roller doors and new paving with landscaped bricked garden beds. Other improvements include: -Fully serviced bore with desalination plant, including tank - 3 x 33,750 litre waterstore poly tanks (7500 gallon) - 17.3 acres / 7 hectares subdivided 4 main paddocks - 2 dams - Excellent fencing - Colorbond shed 22.1m x 14.3m, concrete floor, power, car hoist & heaps of bench space, 5 door entry and exit (Telfords shepp build) - Machinery shed 12.4m x 8.6m, 2nd machinery shed 9.1m x 6.2m both of steel & iron construction and earthen floor.

Description:
Immaculate Family Home
Boasting immaculate gardens and meticulously maintained this family home sits beautifully on an 800m2 block in Maiden Gully.
The spacious floor plan spreads across 23.4sq of living, comforted by ducted heating and cooling systems. A sophisticated kitchen gleams with quality fixtures and fittings. Caesar stone benches host a gas cooktop and handsomely clad cabinets house a dishwasher and wall oven. All 3 living zones are large and 2 border an outdoor entertaining area beneath the roofline of the house. Tank water is pumped indoors to flush toilets, though mains town water is also connected to the property.
The master bedroom comes with walk-in robe, plus ensuite appointed with lengthy vanity and 1200mm shower. All 3 other bedrooms have built-in robes, while built-in desk can be removed if required from 1 currently used as a home office.
Private and secure, boundary fencing also encloses a 7x11 metre Colorbond shed with concrete floor, built in work bench, shelving and power. Drive-through side gates to shed (3.2m wide) and a concreted parking bay that secures a caravan, boat or trailer, while making mowing so much easier. Well-kept gardens incorporate raised veggie beds and landscaping. A double garage with auto roller door allows private access to the home.
Walk or ride bikes to nearby pre- and primary schools, IGA and Pratty's Patch restaurant. This well-established neighbourhood has a wonderful family focus and community vibe.
Internal area
23m²

Bordering Sedgwick and Myrtle Creek, this is a great opportunity to purchase in such a beautiful area of Central Victoria.

The undulating parcel of land offers great views for those seeking to build a dream home (STCA), or for those simply looking for somewhere for a weekend retreat to escape the hustle and bustle of city living. Services available are power and phone at the top corner.
Your serene lifestyle begins with a phone call.
Enquire now!

Description:
THE PERFECT START!
Located in close proximity to popular Lake Weeroona and the Bendigo Hospital precinct comes this absolute charmer that offers you an ideal start into the booming local property market! Only a short walk to your local neighbourhood cafes and hotel and a manageable walk to the city centre, you have the convenience of all your desired amenities within arms reach of your very own place to call home!
Cosy, comfortable and affordable, the property will ideally suit first home buyers looking for a quality start but will also tempt the astute investor looking for a desirable start or addition to their portfolio. The fully renovated interior has loads of features which make it a standout in this price bracket. Features include ducted heating and cooling, lovely timber floors, modern fixtures and fittings, and the peace of mind you can move in and enjoy without having to do anything!
The floor plan features three bedrooms, two have built in robes whilst the master bedroom has walk in robe and its own modern ensuite. The main bathroom has been recently renovated and features both shower and free standing bath. The central kitchen has also been updated and boasts electric under bench oven, gas cook top, dishwasher, pantry and good storage and bench space. A European laundry has been cleverly tucked away at the back of the dining/second living space at the rear of the home, whilst the cosy lounge at the front serves as the main living space in the home.
Outside, the main alfresco area lies at the front of the home, shaded by a seasonal tree at the front and a great spot to sit and enjoy a drink with friends. Fresh landscaping at the front includes newly laid turf, whilst at the back there is a split level grassed area, fruit trees and fabulous fire pit area. Off street parking is thanks to a single lock up carport, with room for an extra car in front behind the attractive front fence whilst there is plenty of room for storage of tools and garden equipment under the house.
A gorgeous little home packed full of features, this truly is the ideal way to enter the property market. Coupled with a convenient location and a hot segment of the market, there is every chance this wont last long at all. So call now to enquire to avoid the disappointment of missing out!

Description:
5 Bedroom Family Property including Unit in Strathdale
Set on a massive 1700m2 double-sized lot, this spacious property offers a four bedroom home with very generous bedrooms, main with walk-in robe and ensuite, and all others with built-in robes. Cavernous living areas include a formal dining room and lounge room, while the kitchen has electric appliances, dishwasher and plenty of storage for a larger family.
Ducted gas heating and reverse cycle air-conditioning ensure year round climate control.
A major feature of the property is the fully self-contained 1 bedroom unit adjoining the home.
Originally used as a Nana Flat, the unit would be ideal for any dependent family member, home office (STCA) or to simply rent out. The unit has a spacious living area, built-in robes in the bedroom, full kitchen and bathroom.
To the outside and there is undercover accommodation for three cars and off street parking for another three.
Huge back yard with drive through access, and more than enough room for that dream shed or further units (STCA).
A large alfresco area overlooks the non-functioning pool.
The home has been in the same ownership since 1987 and testifies to the liveability of the property and the area.
All this within walking distance to Kennington Primary and St Theresa's schools, Kennington Village, Kennington Reserve and Reservoir, Crook St Creche, parkland, public transport and more.
The Bendigo Club and the Bowling Green are also close by.
With the Government announced $25K to assist with renovation, this might be your perfect opportunity to buy in a tightly-held and sought-after location.

The beautiful open entrance gives way to plenty of space, with approximately 3 acres of park filled with native and exotic trees and bushland, 800m of walking paths as well as benches and shelter making the perfect spot to get together. All allotments are titled and are waiting to be built on.
Situated on 449m2 with a frontage of 21m, offers a great option for side driveway access depending on design. Being a small allotment it also promotes a great opportunity for investors to put townhouses or units on, or build smaller home without the ongoing maintenance of a large yard.

The beautiful open entrance gives way to plenty of space, with approximately 3 acres of park filled with native and exotic trees and bushland, 800m of walking paths as well as benches and shelter making the perfect spot to get together. All allotments are titled and are waiting to be built on.
899m2 with a little over 17m frontage and 50m in depth, this is one of the larger premium allotments which has just come available recently. Opposite the lovely parklands and partially fenced. This property has scope for a larger home offering space for a pool and a shed.

Description:
VIBRANT, AFFORDABLE 4 BEDROOM HOME IN STRATHFIELDSAYE
This vibrant 4-bedroom home is in the ideal location with only a short drive to Strathfieldsaye shops giving you great access to cafes, restaurants, takeaways and supermarket. Plus parks and walking tracks are nearby too.
Offering a tasteful design and quality appointments with a large kitchen featuring stainless steel appliances, walk in pantry and ample bench space. There are 3 separate living areas, great size master with walk-in-robe and ensuite and a remote double garage with side access for the caravan.
The home has ducted heating, ducting cooling and summer entertaining is catered for with a covered alfresco area directly from the living space.
Enjoy an ideal location and quality, affordable home.
Inspection a must!
